You can create an Maximum indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the Maximum constructor.

Maximum()1/2

            Maximum QuantConnect.Indicators.Maximum (
     int  period
   )

Creates a new Maximum indicator with the specified period.

Parameters
int period The period over which to look back.

Return

Maximum - The new Maximum indicator object.

Definition at line 43 of file Indicators/Maximum.cs.

Maximum()2/2

            Maximum QuantConnect.Indicators.Maximum (
     string  name,
     int     period
   )

Creates a new Maximum indicator with the specified period.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The period over which to look back.

Return

Maximum - The new Maximum indicator object.

Definition at line 53 of file Indicators/Maximum.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.


private Maximum _max;

// In Initialize()
_max = new Maximum(name, period);
_max.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _max, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_max.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _max.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.max = Maximum(name, period)
self.max.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.max, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.max.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.max.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

    
private Maximum _max;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_max = new Maximum(period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _max.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_max.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _max.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.max = Maximum(period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.max.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.max.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.max.Current.Value
